hypothesis: David Bowie received gold certifications in the United States for each of his albums.
premise: + David Bowie + In the US , he received five platinum and seven gold certifications . + David Bowie + In the UK , he was awarded nine platinum album certifications , eleven gold and eight silver , releasing eleven number-one albums . + List of artists by number of UK Albums Chart number ones + The UK Albums Chart is a weekly record chart based on album sales from Friday to Thursday in the United Kingdom ( the chart week ran from Sunday to Saturday until 2015 ) .
explanation_1: David Bowie has received gold certifications in the United States for each of his albums.

hypothesis: Patty Hearst was kidnapped by the Symbionese Liberation Army in Berkeley, California.
premise: + Patty Hearst + Hearst was abducted by a left-wing terrorist group known as the Symbionese Liberation Army . + Patty Hearst + She became nationally known for events following her 1974 kidnapping while she was a 19-year-old student living in Berkeley , California . + Symbionese Liberation Army + The SLA became internationally notorious for the kidnapping of heiress Patty Hearst , abducting the 19-year-old from Berkeley , California . + Berkeley, California + Berkeley  is a city on the east shore of San Francisco Bay in northern Alameda County , California .
explanation_1: Patty Hearst was kidnapped by the Symbionese Liberation Army in 1974.

hypothesis: Sigmund Freud set up his practice.
premise: + Sigmund Freud + Freud lived and worked in Vienna , having set up his clinical practice there in 1886 . + Sigmund Freud + Sigmund Freud (   born Sigismund Schlomo Freud ; 6 May 1856 - 23 September 1939 ) was an Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis , a clinical method for treating psychopathology through dialogue between a patient and a psychoanalyst .
explanation_1: Sigmund Freud set up his practice in Vienna.

hypothesis: Hungarians have a number of subgroups including the Palóc people.
premise: + Hungarians + Hungarians can be classified into several subgroups according to local linguistic and cultural characteristics ; subgroups with distinct identities include the Székelys , the Csángós , the Palóc , and the Jász people . + Palóc + The Palóc are a subgroup of Hungarians in Northern Hungary and southern Slovakia . + Hungarians + Hungarians , also known as Magyars ( magyarok ) , are a nation and ethnic group who speak Hungarian and are primarily associated with Hungary . + Székelys + The Székelys  , sometimes also referred to as Szeklers ( székelyek , Secui , Szekler , Siculi ) , are a subgroup of the Hungarian people living mostly in the Székely Land in Romania .
explanation_1: The relevant information about the claim is lacking in the context.

hypothesis: Tesla, Inc. makes the Model S.
premise: + Tesla Model X + The Tesla Model X is a full-sized , all-electric , luxury , crossover SUV made by Tesla Inc. that uses falcon wing doors for access to the second and third row seats . + Tesla, Inc. + The company 's second vehicle , the Model S , an electric luxury sedan , debuted in 2012 and is built at the Tesla Factory in California . + Tesla Model S + The Tesla Model S is a full-sized all-electric five-door , luxury liftback , produced by Tesla Inc. , and introduced on 22nd June 2012 . + Sport utility vehicle + A sport utility vehicle or suburban utility vehicle ( SUV ) is a vehicle classified as a light truck , but operated as a family vehicle . + Tesla, Inc. + , the Model S ranks as the world 's all-time second best-selling plug-in after the Nissan Leaf .
explanation_1: Tesla, Inc. makes the Model S, which is a full-sized all-electric five-door, luxury liftback.

hypothesis: Lauren Graham is an American.
premise: + Lauren Graham + Lauren Helen Graham ( born March 16 , 1967 ) is an American actress and author .
explanation_1: Lauren Graham is an American actress and author.

hypothesis: Kristen Bell's first major role was as Veronica Mars.
premise: + Kristen Bell + Bell gained critical acclaim for her first major role as the title character in the teen noir drama television series Veronica Mars ( 2004 - 07 ) . + Veronica Mars + Veronica Mars is an American teen noir mystery drama television series created by screenwriter Rob Thomas . + Veronica Mars (character) + Veronica Mars is the fictional protagonist , occasional narrator ( through voiceovers ) , and antiheroine of the American television series Veronica Mars , which aired on UPN from 2004 to 2006 and on The CW from 2006 to 2007 . + Veronica Mars + The series is set in the fictional town of Neptune , California , and stars Kristen Bell as the eponymous character .
explanation_1: Kristen Bell's first major role was as Veronica Mars.

hypothesis: Memento earned money.
premise: + Memento (film) + It became a blockbuster success , being acclaimed by critics who praised its nonlinear narrative structure and motifs of memory , perception , grief , and self-deception , and earning $ 39.7 million over a $ 9 million budget .
explanation_1: Memento earned $ 39.7 million over a $ 9 million budget.

hypothesis: The Dark Knight Rises' filming took place in Pennsylvania.
premise: + The Dark Knight Rises + Filming took place in locations including Jodhpur , London , Nottingham , Glasgow , Los Angeles , New York City , Newark , and Pittsburgh . + Pittsburgh + Pittsburgh  is a city in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in the United States , and is the county seat of Allegheny County .
explanation_1: The Dark Knight Rises was filmed in locations including Jodhpur, London, Nottingham, Glasgow, Los Angeles, New York City, Newark, and Pittsburgh.

hypothesis: Charles II of England was prince of England.
premise: + Charles II of England + Charles II ( 29 May 1630 - 6 February 1685 ) was king of England , Scotland and Ireland . + Charles II of England + He was king of Scotland from 1649 until his deposition in 1651 , and king of England , Scotland and Ireland from the restoration of the monarchy in 1660 until his death . + Restoration (1660) + In 1660 the monarchy was restored to the kingdoms of England , Ireland and Scotland in the person of Charles II . + Kingdom of Ireland + The Kingdom of Ireland ( Classical Irish : Ríoghacht Éireann ; Modern Irish : Ríocht Éireann ) was a client state of the Kingdom of England that existed on Ireland from 1542 until 1800 .
explanation_1: Charles II was king of England, Scotland and Ireland. He was not prince of England.

hypothesis: Vikrant Massey wrote V The Serial.

hypothesis: Filmfare is a phone that's printed or electronically published.
premise: + Filmfare + Filmfare is an English-language , tabloid-sized magazine about Hindi-language cinema , popularly known as Bollywood . + Bollywood + Bollywood is the sobriquet for India 's Hindi language film industry , based in the city of Mumbai , Maharashtra . + Filmfare + Established in 1952 , the magazine is published by Worldwide Media , a subsidiary of The Times Group , India 's largest media services conglomerate . + Filmfare + Filmfare is one of the most popular entertainment magazine in India .
explanation_1: Filmfare is a magazine, not a phone.

hypothesis: Give Me Everything is the second single from Dale.

explanation_1: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice features Batman, Superman, Cyborg, Wonder Woman and the fictional character Victor Stone.

hypothesis: Christina Applegate died before the production of the film Bad Moms began.
premise: + Christina Applegate + She has had major roles in several films , including Do n't Tell Mom the Babysitter 's Dead ( 1991 ) , The Big Hit ( 1998 ) , Prince Charming ( 2001 ) , The Sweetest Thing ( 2002 ) , Grand Theft Parsons ( 2003 ) , Anchorman : The Legend of Ron Burgundy ( 2004 ) and its sequel , Anchorman 2 : The Legend Continues ( 2013 ) , Farce of the Penguins ( 2007 ) , Hall Pass ( 2011 ) , Vacation ( 2015 ) and Bad Moms ( 2016 ) . + The Big Hit + The Big Hit is a 1998 American action comedy film directed by Hong Kong filmmaker Che-Kirk Wong , and stars Mark Wahlberg , China Chow , Lou Diamond Phillips , Christina Applegate , Bokeem Woodbine , Antonio Sabato , Jr. , Avery Brooks and Elliott Gould . + Bad Moms + Bad Moms is a 2016 American black comedy film directed and written by Jon Lucas and Scott Moore . + Hall Pass + Hall Pass is a 2011 American romantic comedy film produced and directed by the Farrelly brothers and co-written by them along with Pete Jones , the writer/director of Stolen Summer . + Grand Theft Parsons + Grand Theft Parsons is a 2003 film based on the true story of country rock musician Gram Parsons ( played by Gabriel Macht ) , who died of an overdose in 1973 .

hypothesis: Vikram has starred in the 2012 film Deiva Thirumagal.
premise: + Vikram (actor) + Vikram 's portrayal of Veeraiya , a tribal leader inspired by the Ramayana character Ravana , in Mani Ratnam 's Raavanan saw him secure further accolades , as did his appearance as a mentally challenged adult with the maturity of a six-year-old boy in Deiva Thirumagal ( 2011 ) . + Vikram (actor) + He has been a brand ambassador of Sanjeevani Trust and a school for special children , Vidya Sudha , which he stayed at during the making of Deiva Thirumagal as well as having long-term associations with the Kasi Eye Care and running his own welfare association through the Vikram Foundation . + Deiva Thirumagal + Deiva Thirumagal ( English translation : God 's Daughter ) is a 2011 Indian Tamil-language legal drama film written and directed by A. L. Vijay and produced by M. Chinthamani and Ronnie Screwvala that features Vikram in the lead role as a mentally challenged adult with the maturity of a six-year-old boy , while Baby Sarah , Anushka Shetty , Amala Paul and Nassar portray other pivotal roles .
explanation_1: Vikram has starred in the 2011 film Deiva Thirumagal.
